title: Processes - Average Value of a Function

content.question: The intensity of radiation at a distance <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> meters from a source is modeled by the function <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> given by <math alttext="R of x, equals, the fraction with numerator k, and denominator x squared, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="k" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is a positive constant. Which of the following gives the average intensity of radiation between 10 meters and 50 meters from the source?

choices.label: <math alttext="negative, the fraction k over 50, end fraction, plus the fraction k over 10" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>50</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction 1 over 40, times, open parenthesis, negative, the fraction k over 50, plus the fraction k over 10, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>40</mn></mrow></mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>50</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="one half, times, open parenthesis, the fraction k over 100, end fraction, plus the fraction k over 2500, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>100</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2500</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction 1 over 40, times, open parenthesis, negative, the fraction k over 50, plus the fraction k over 10, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>40</mn></mrow></mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>50</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 8.1: Finding the Average Value of a Function on an Interval

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
